oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Herd-level prevalence of Johne's disease and BVD, management practices and farm characteristics for positive dairy herds in Utah and Idaho
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Wilson, David J.
Rood, Kerry A.
Whitehouse, Chelsea
Bunnell, Jennifer
Goodell, Gregory M.
Byrem, Todd M.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Johne's disease
bovine viral diarrhea
BVD
dairy cattle
cattle diseases
infertility
regional prevalence
management
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Johne's disease (JD) and bovine viral diarrhea (BVD) are expensive dairy cattle diseases causing production, infertility, and death losses. Herd-level prevalence estimates are 68% for JD and 15% for BVD. The objectives of this study were to estimate regional dairy herd-level prevalence of JD and BVD and evaluate farm characteristics, management, and control practices on farms with either disease detected.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2018; 305
